title: Nice place for Art lovers
review: This was one of the very good choice of our group member to plan visit to this place to buy some items.

title: Appreciation for a lost Art
review: I know this is one of those stops western tourist end up making, but the history and the actual fabrication of in laying marble does blow you away. The buying presentation would make for a good comedy in my eyes. (eg, as soon as they realized I wasn't buying, the show room lights went dim and the tables were lit up. When that didn't lead me to purchase, we were lead to another room with smaller pieces and when that didn't work we went to another room with even smaller pieces.)

title: Shahin Arts
review: We had a tour and did some shopping. The tour was exceptional! Looking at how they produced the pieces and their craftsmanship was well worth the tour. I purchased a side table for my wife and a small "Tree of Life" plate for my office. Expensive, but in my mind worth it.

title: Nice
review: Geotechnical engineering deals with materials (e.g. soil and rock) that, by their very nature, exhibit varied and uncertain behavior due to the imprecise physical processes associated with the formation of these materials. Modeling the behavior of such materials in geotechnical engineering applications is complex and sometimes beyond the ability of most traditional forms of physically-based engineering methods. Artificial intelligence (AI) is becoming more popular and particularly amenable to modeling the complex behavior of most geotechnical engineering applications because it has demonstrated superior predictive ability compared to traditional methods.

title: The hard sell, but doesn't everyone try in sales.
review: Really no one goes with the idea of buying a table and soon you are convinced you cannot live without one.  A nice demo, free drinks, pleasant staff.  Prices were high but so too was some of the work.  They start you off at the high end priced tables and then take you through lots of different rooms and cheaper prices.  Do haggle if you fall in love despite being told they are fixed by the tour guy.

title: Old crafts are the best
review: I taught gem-cutting for over twenty years but this was mind-blowing! The descendants of the Persians brought in to help build the Taj Mahal are still working their old skills using the same care and equipment. The small size of each gem piece is remarkable and how they use these beautiful colours (lapis, malachite, turquoise, carnelian etc wow!) to build up decorations, flowers etc. is remarkable. The marble used is a lovely translucent white (light will shine through it), tough and resistant. One can buy a small coffee table top (fold able legs supplied) which can easily be taken overseas. Prices are good, too.

title: Interesting demonstration.
review: The information and demonstration of how the stones were prepared for the Taj Mahal are very interesting. They make some wonderful things. It is a little uncomfortable when you do not want to buy anything. However, they make you very welcome and you are not obliged to buy.

title: Beautiful workmanship
review: The skills and artistry displayed here is absolutley unique. If you visit the Taj Mahal and go inside you will see 16th century examples of whats being offered by this co-operative. A co-operative of families that are multiple generations old. When you look at the finished peices take a minute to obseve the size of the patterns, the number of colours, and complexity.  Ultimately the price is dependant on these factors

title: fed up
review: not to my taste. every tour guide gets commission if you buy anything from these stores. this spoilt my day.

title: Good Tourist Trap
review: This Arts centre has an interesting demonstration of how the inlaid work is done with semi precious stones into marble.There are numerous rooms each selling different goods made in the area leather work clothing etc. and so well staffed.  However everything was very expensive and not worth the money they were asking for. Given a drink on arrival too. Lots of tour groups going around.

title: Shahin arts
review: It is like paradise for arts lover..here you observe many artifact during of mughal and indo arabic style culture..must come on your agra tour

title: Amazing works of art.
review: The work the people do here,  is similar to the work that was carried out at the Taj. Treat yourself, or get a special gift for someone. They ship their work all over the world so if you choose something too large for your suit case, done worry.  They work with semi precious stones on marble. Worth a visit.

title: not good as we heard"
review: its an interesting place to see difference types of arts, wanted to see local market than our guide bring us here to shop. stuff are good and beautiful but price is more than double. There is prompting to buy the product, but it's not a way to deal with customers.

title: Inlaid marble and semiprecious stonework
review: The workmanship was beautiful and well worth seeing.  Only regret I did not buy more!  A bit of hard sale tactics, but politely carried out.

title: Amazing workmanship
review: Amazing workmanship, in the style of ancient times but beware the hard sell. Beautiful little gifts ranging up to valuable keepsakes worth thousands....

title: Beautiful Table Tops
review: Small area showing you how table top inlays are made. Beautiful articles but expensive - although bartering can get you 30% off - and they deliver.

title: Beautiful, quality work of skilled artists
review: We were so lucky to be able to stop and see this wonderful shop and craft.  And we opted to buy a table and are anxiously awaiting its arrival.  Wonderful artisans and businessmen at this shop.

title: Wonderful workmanship
review: this was a very interesting place to visit.

title: You need to be rich
review: Its ok.  We stopped due to our tour and I found the first few minutes interesting watching the artists but then the pressure comes on to buy.  I appreciate the artistry and work but its not really my scene, if you love marble and have the money go but otherwise there are better things to do in Agra

title: Interesting and beautiful
review: We stopped with our tour and watched the men work on these marble pieces creating intricate plates and table tops.

title: okay
review: Fantastic but VERY EXPENSIVE. a BIT OF A HARD SELL. Miniture Taj Mahal £25 here at the hotel they were £7

title: A nice shopping place
review: Local Artists selling really nice works. They have all kinds of tables, elephants.. in all price ranges.

title: Nice shop
review: It is a nice shop to buy arts craft. The variety is nice, but never buys at first sight. You can bargain for at least 50% of the original price

title: An extremely interesting place to visit
review: To watch the craftsmen shaping each gem stone, by hand, to fit the hole made in the white marble was fascinating - Wonderful workmanship. Like all places after seeing how it's done you get 'it's time to buy'! Not so good.

title: If You want to know HOW it's made
review: Although we were not told this was a shopping shop (billed as a cultural center), you are first asked to sit and watch the workmen demonstrate how they take pieces of precious stones or rocks or ore and turn it into beautiful pieces of art.  According to the guide, many of these workmen are direct descendants of the laborers who built the Taj Mahal and they are passed down the secrets of how the Taj was built.  Very interesting to watch them handle minute pieces by hand. Then you are made to go inside the store and watch a demonstration of the durability of the finished beautiful products.  And they are VERY beautiful and PRICY.

title: Shahin Arts
review: Our guide took us to this shop where in visitors are shown how various showpieces with inlaid stone designs are made by craftsman. The shop is quiet expensive but conducive for bargaining.

title: Yes we bought something!
review: Watched the craftsmen shape and hone the pieces of precious stones to be inlaid into various pieces of artwork. We were shown so many pieces of marble in many different sizes. From small plates to large solid marble tables. All a joy to behold. We bought an octagonal piece which is now in 'pride of place' on our dining room table. Expensive but worth it!

title: Fascinating and historical process
review: It was really interesting to see the way that these amazing pieces have been made for generations.  A bit of a hard sell, but enjoyable.

title: Nice but their goal is to sell!
review: This place was interesting in terms of how inlaid stone objects are made, however I never like when, after showing the process, they then spend 45+ minutes trying to get you to buy - and they are not happy when you don't. We have learned long ago not to be 'guilted' into buying, so we are respectful and attentive, but make it clear that we are not interested in purchasing. The things there are beautiful so if you are in the market for this type of thing, you will have quite a variety to choose from. As others have said, bargain, bargain, bargain! The prices are very high but they will come down by at least half if you hold your ground (still didn't buy). One other thing, in general, beware of stories regarding mothers, fathers, grandmothers, sisters etc. who are descendants, relatives, etc. who designed, built, carved themselves any item, as you will see the exact same items throughout India - and in the airport shops cheaper!

title: Amazing
review: Wow... I would highly suggest that you get a tour of this place and see how they inlaid marble pieces are made. We were all stunned at the complexity of every piece... and this is exactly how the Taj Mahal was made. The pieces are very expensive, but once you see how they were made, it's worth it.

title: very interesting
review: what an interesting place to visit the workmanship is wonderful shame that it is so heavy to bring back loved it

title: one of a kind
review: Our guide took us to this place, and we were impressed to see how they make all this beautiful art pieces. To much work, and unique in its kind. We even tried to work on it, but too hard for a proffession of 14 generations. worth visiting and buing something unique

title: Beautiful Art Work
review: Beautiful art work by the descendants of the original artisans of the Taj Mahal. There is a short tour and demonstrations of how pieces are put together. Pieces are beautiful and very special. Also quite expensive. Two of our group of six bought beautiful plates. I was the only one who didn't. The owners gave me a small elephant as a parting gift. (I think they felt a bit sorry for me. ) I did enjoy the demonstration and hospitality very much.

title: A great shop
review: Our guide took us to this place to see the way they inlay the marble and really is a wonderful place, not so sure about the prices though but I am going to find out and maybe I will buy something once I am back home: they deliver all over the world anyway.

title: marble arts
review: Lovely artistic things in marble and a talk all about the craft. But beware it is a hard sell. I was quite uncomfortable as they press you to buy all the time.

title: Beautiful art, luxury prices
review: See how the artistic inlays of the Taj Mahal were made. We visited this shop at the request of my travel mate who had been before. The intricate designs were impressive and the hospitality felt genuine. Prices were too high for my budget, although people seem to return to this shop to buy. Perhaps if you are in the market for a lovely dish or other item with artistic inlays, this might be the place for you. In all cases, it was cool to see how the inlays are made since we were already in Agra.

title: Beautiful work
review: They do beautiful work and have many gorgeous pieces of all sizes and price ranges. Be sure to negotiate the best price. They ship back to the US for $50, and probably anywhere else you need it ro go, so you don't have to worry about protecting you purchase the rest of your trip.

title: pricy and not worth
review: when i visited i fell in love with a coaster which they charged 100 aus dollars and so i brought it anyways , when i went to the airport they had the exact same coasters , same material, same quality for 50 aus dollars.

title: Good design with wide range of items
review: We have visited in this shop during find some memorable craft items. We have find wide range of marble crafted gift items and regular home used marble items with very nice painting and pictures.

title: nice
review: its very nice .nice collection...i m impressed but i found it little costly than others.......overall good

title: Amazing craftmanship
review: When I arrived  we went into the demonstrating room and I was even lucky enough to try and do what some of the men do every day to create beautiful items such as tables and much more. I was so luck that I was gifted a lapizlazuli and some other semi precious stone elephant. And if you did not already know that these people are from the same family's that did the inlay on the tajmhal and are supported very well by their local government. Clin was very good I even played chess with him although he beat me 2 times.

title: Take the time
review: This was very interesting. In addition to what they do here they also share a great deal of history on the jewel work done at the taj mahal

title: Short tour is engaging!
review: Watch the artisans creating beautiful inlaid marble masterpieces.The process is clearly demonstrated followed by a tour of the finished products. There is encouragement to purchase the product, but it's not overbearing.

title: Appreciation for a lost Art
review: I know this is one of those stops western tourist end up making, but the history and the actual fabrication of in laying marble does blow you away. The buying presentation would make for a good comedy in my eyes. (eg, as soon as they realized I wasn't buying, the show room lights went dim and the tables were lit up. When that didn't lead me to purchase, we were lead to another room with smaller pieces and when that didn't work we went to another room with even smaller pieces.)

title: The hard sell, but doesn't everyone try in sales.
review: Really no one goes with the idea of buying a table and soon you are convinced you cannot live without one.  A nice demo, free drinks, pleasant staff.  Prices were high but so too was some of the work.  They start you off at the high end priced tables and then take you through lots of different rooms and cheaper prices.  Do haggle if you fall in love despite being told they are fixed by the tour guy.

title: Gorgeous Pieces
review: This place has gorgeous pieces to offer and great stories to go with the pieces but I'm not sure how much I believe about the stories. If you're in to that kind of thing: marble and stones, you should stop by.

title: Where I brought my Elephant
review: Very  good to see how the work was done on the Taj,they have kept the skill going to this day.It takes ages for the craftsmen to make one flower, the Elephant I brought is only small but it took 46 day to make one flower and there are four flowers on the back of the Elephant

title: Nice
review: Geotechnical engineering deals with materials (e.g. soil and rock) that, by their very nature, exhibit varied and uncertain behavior due to the imprecise physical processes associated with the formation of these materials. Modeling the behavior of such materials in geotechnical engineering applications is complex and sometimes beyond the ability of most traditional forms of physically-based engineering methods. Artificial intelligence (AI) is becoming more popular and particularly amenable to modeling the complex behavior of most geotechnical engineering applications because it has demonstrated superior predictive ability compared to traditional methods.

title: Good place for shoppers
review: was taken here by our tour guide, like most tours in India, ended buying a marble plate with the taj mahal on it, this was very pretty and not badly priced, after negotiating of course.

review: We had a tour and did some shopping. The tour was exceptional! Looking at how they produced the pieces and their craftsmanship was well worth the tour. I purchased a side table for my wife and a small "Tree of Life" plate for my office. Expensive, but in my mind worth it.

Ultimately the price is dependant on these factors
